sentences.sContent: Children under 14 should be accompanied by a parent.
sentences.sCn: 14 岁以下儿童须由一位家长陪同。

sentences.sContent: The eggs are guarded by both parents.
sentences.sCn: 那些蛋由两只亲鸟共同守护着。

sentences.sContent: Melissa’s spending the weekend at her parents’ house.
sentences.sCn: 梅利莎正在父母家度周末。

sentences.sContent: ...So what m a parent to do...
...there is no parent at home most days...
...it’s difficult to know whether to approach the child directly or the parent first...
...Asked how to approach a parent in this situation...
...He points out bringing it up with the parent first may make them feel neglectful...

synos.tran: 父亲（或母亲）；父母亲；根源

phrases.pCn: n. 单亲；单身母亲；单身父亲
[地质]母质；母质层；[电子]母体材料；初始物质

words.tran: 父母亲的，父母的；亲代的，亲本的
出身；亲子关系；门第；起源

trans.tranOther: the father or mother of a person or animal
